pages.text: It is possible to produce Rocket Fuel sustainably on Mars without the need for Oil. This makes Mars the perfect location for a Space Port. There are three key stages to this process: Electrolysis, Synthesis and Liquefication.

pages.title: Electrolysis
pages.text: Electrolysis is the process of splitting water into Hydrogen and Oxygen using electricity. This can be done using Galacticraft's  $(item)Water Electrolyzer$() or NuclearCraft's  $(item)Electrolyzer$(). Water can be obtained using a Buildcraft Pump and Oxygen is a useful byproduct in space. Note that small infinite water sources do not exist in this modpack. Instead you will need to draw water from a larger body of water.

pages.title: Synthesis
pages.text: Synthesis is the process of turning Hydrogen and Carbon Dioxide into Methane. This can be done using Galacticraft's  $(item)Methane Synthesizer$(). Carbon Dioxide can be obtained on Mars simply by putting an Atmospheric Valve or Carbon Fragments in the Methane Synthesizer.

pages.title: Liquefication
pages.text: Liquefication is the process of turning Methane Gas into liquid Fuel. This can be done using Galacticraft's  $(item)Gas Liquefier$() or NuclearCraft's  $(item)Supercooler$(). Once you have done this, the Fuel can be used to power a Rocket, a Buggy or a Combustion Engine.

pages.title: Water on Mars
pages.text: This crater has been flooded with water to create an infinite water source.
